Quickstride quickly tries to shield Leo ll and Wind Caliber from flying deb=
ris using an on board shield, fashioned on his cannon.  Uproar crouches to =
avoid the debris.

" Son of a glitch! GRRRRR!  NO ONE MESSES WITH THE ARK A=
ND GETS AWAY WITH IT! WHY DON'T YOU HAUL YOUR COCKY AFT OUT HERE AND FACE U=
S LIKE A REAL WARRIOR!"

Quickstride snorts.

"Yeah, quit hidn' behind your=
 little fire crackers 'n fight like real bots!"

Uproar raises a brow.

"He=
eey, wait a minute, Leo ll, Wind Caliber, I got an idea.  Cover your noses,=
 this might get stinky.  Hey, Quickstride, eat any bean pods lately?"

Quic=
kstride raises a brow, and transforms into his beast mode.

"As a matter of=
 fact, I did.  And a lot of 'em.  Stand back fellas, stay down wind, and tr=
y not ta breathe any of this in.  We're about ta stink out the biggest stin=
ker in this place!"

He turns his rump in the direction of where the intrud=
er is, and releases his stink attack.

Meanwhile, on the way back to the Ar=
k, Tucson gets Rodimus's report.  He is not happy with what he hears.  Almo=
st immediately, his temper begins to escalate.

" NO, NO, NO, NOOOO!  NO ON=
E DISTURBS THE ARK!  NO ONE!

His engine rumbles with the power of his ange=
r.  It gives him just enough power to start his engine.

Rat Trap gasps.

"=
Woah, easy Wheels...  Guys, ya better let those harnesses go, Wheels isn't =
in a really good mood..."

Night Shift notices the change in his leader.

"=
Ohh scrap, he's right!  Guys, he's got his engines up!  We can drop the har=
nesses!"

Tucson's engine roars back to life, yet he doesn't take off in a =
mad dash as of yet.

" THE ARK IS IN PERRIL!  AND I WILL NOT LET IT FALL TO=
 THE ENEMY!  MAXIMALS, WE NEED TO PUT IT IN FULL GEAR  AND GET BACK BEFORE =
ANYONE IS HARMED OR ANYTHING IS DAMAGED!"

He then transmits to Rodimus.

"=
RODIMUS, IF YOU CAN HEAR ME, I'M ON MY WAY, AND MARK MY WORDS WHOEVER IS TH=
ERE NOW WILL WISH THEY HADN'T ATTEMPTED THE INFILTRATION! I WANT THAT ENEMY=
 IMMOBILIZED AND BROUGHT TO ME UPON MY ARRIVAL! THEY WANT TORMENT?!  I'LL S=
HOW THEM TORMENT!"

Rat Trap sits back, hear thumping a mile a minute.

" O=
hh boy Talon, he's ticked...  No telln' what's gonna happen when he gets ba=
ck ta the Ark now.."

It was clear, if there was any temper left in Tucson,=
 he had just lost it completely.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Super Cycl=
onus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
>
> INSIDE THE ARK
> 
> As Uproar and Quick=
stride follow Leo II and Wing Caliber up towards the
> bridge, the trip is =
nothing if not dark and silent. There is virtually no
> sound, except for t=
he small sounds that the four themselves make as they
> walked.
> 
> Leo II=
 and Wing Caliber both seem adept at walking soundlessly, staying
> close t=
o the shadows, but in this oppressive silence, even their footfalls
> could=
 be heard at times, magnified by the echoing in the halls.
> 
> As they app=
roach the bridge, the door actually slid open as the get close =96
> appare=
ntly even if the rest of the ship is without power, the bridge still
> has =
it.
> 
> Screens line the walls as Leo II, Wing Caliber, Quickstride and Up=
roar walk
> on the bridge.
> 
> "Where is the intruder." Leo II growled und=
er his breath. He also sniffed
> the air looking for any trace of him.
> 
>=
 Wing Caliber walked over to one of the console, "Sir look!"
> 
> Leo II wa=
lked over to see what Wing Caliber was pointing at. And there on
> the scre=
en was the image of the front bay where the inert forms of Optimus
> Prime =
and Megatron as well as the other Autobots and Decepticons were
> laying. H=
owever in the corner of the screen there was a timed count down of
> 2 minu=
tes.
> 
> "It's a bomb!" Caliber said. "We have to get back to the main cha=
mber, now!"
> 
> It was only then that there was a quiet chuckle from the c=
orner as a dark
> figure stepped from the shadows. It was difficult to tell=
, but he looked
> like one of the old seekers, like Thundercracker or Skywa=
rp, although his
> marking were somewhat different. He was shrouded in dark=
 blacks and purples
> and about the same size as any other Predacon or Maxi=
mal. "No, you won't."
> he said, his voice barely above a whisper. "You wil=
l stay here and watch
> your friends, and your entire world go up in flames=
!"
> 
> There was a dark chuckle as the figure disappeared and the doors to=
 the
> bridge opened and then closed, to be followed closely by a small det=
onation
> on the door!
> 
> It was locked, permanently!
> 
> > <OLD>
> >
> =
> Elita nodded, it was time to be brave, hunt the Predacon could wait; she
=
> opened her tiny com link and call her dad"Daddy!!!! Someone hurted Uncle
=
> Elder... He need Cr or Medic bay...He has fell unconceus... he looks very=

> bad"
>

> Elita get's an answering call from Rodimus, "You ju=
st stay put little one I
> am on the way to you now. Try to keep Lord Elder=
 out of sight until I get
> there."
> 
> Even as Rodimus spoke, almost as i=
f he could hear them speak about him Lord
> Elder groaned and moved slightl=
y, but did not regain consciousness.
> 
> > <OLD>
> >
> > "This was a... Em=
otional lapsus, dont expect to wacth a lot"said coldly
> Perceptor but then=
 his voice was tunned with a slight pride"Above all my
> creations, the Bla=
ckFortress was the greatest"and added with a more cold
> tone"But sometimes=
... Sacrifies are needed"
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> Santon and Bump looked at each ot=
her and then shrugged a small smile on
> their faces.
> 
> "Of course." Leg=
acy said in cold tones. He turned to regard the ex Predacon
> scientist, "H=
owever there may yet be time to construct another, perhaps
> putting it to =
better use this time."
> 
> 
> 
> 
> ON THE WAY BACK TO THE ARK
> 
> The tr=
ip back is longer then any of them had anticipated. Having to carry
> and p=
ull the large bulk of Tuscon back to the base was not the fastest mode
> of=
 travel.
> 
> However there did not seem to be any opposition either. There=
 was no hint of
> Predacon or Decepticon energy signature to be felt. Not a=
 single wrong smell
> and or anything out of the ordinary, except the feeli=
ng of being watched.
> 
> > <OLD>
> >
> > [Tuscon] now turns his com link o=
n to Rodimus.
> >
> > "Rodimus, this is Tucson, I need to know the status
>=
 > of the situation at the Ark, over."
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> Rodimus' voice crack=
led as it came over Tuscon's radio, "We are inside the
> Ark now. I have ju=
st been told that Lord Elder is damaged. We are on our way
> to him now." T=
here was a pause and then Rodimus continued, "Leo II, Wing
> Caliber, Uproa=
r and Quickstride went to the bridge to check things out."
> 
> There was a=
 small sound over the radio, "Slag!" Rodimus said after a moment.
> "That s=
ounded like a small explosion coming from the bridge. I'll get back
> to yo=
u." Rodimus signed off.
> 
> Meanwhile as the group continued to trek back =
towards the Ark, high above,
> barely in sight range a large dark form move=
d swiftly through the skies. It
> was like a dark cloud that for a moment o=
bscured the sun. It was not quite a
> bird and more than some dinosaur. How=
ever even at this range its shape was
> easily recognizable =96 a DRAGON!
>=
 
> As quickly as it came it continued to move away towards the north and t=
hen
> east, its attention apparently on something else as if disregarding t=
he
> Autobots and Maximals on the ground.
> 
> For a moment it could be mad=
e out that the figure was carrying two other
> dark forms, the forms hangin=
g in wicked clawed talons. However their
> identities remained unknown as t=
he figure quickly moved further and further
> away, an occasional wing flap=
 propelling it to faster and faster speeds.
> 
> "I detected Minion in that=
 thing." Bantor said.
> 
> Torca grunted, "We had better get back to the Ar=
k quickly."
> 
> With a nod they continued to pull Tuscon west, back toward=
s the Ark.
